I depart from Thomas and others who offer three characteristics of pets: (1) they are allowed in the house, (2) they are given human names, and (3) they are not eaten; 112–17. Many working animals were allowed in the house, and even pets were often given descriptive rather than human names. I agree with the third criterion, but there were many animals that were not eaten—carnivores—that were not pets. 31
